info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 3:54AM MST until February 22 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until Noon MST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from Noon today to 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
